comments:
In one of our unit tests, PublishServerJob is throwing a
ConcurrentModificationException. The unit test in question imports two WTP
projects into a workspace, builds them and tries to publish them to a server. 
One of the projects contains a module that depends on the second (this is the
key distinguishing factor that triggers this bug).  
The dependency is defined in two places:
 - the referencing module definition (.wtpmodules) contains the following:
   <dependent-module deploy-path="/WSAR-INF/lib"
       handle="module:/resource/demo.utility/externalutil">
       <dependency-type>uses</dependency-type>
   </dependent-module>  
- the referencing project file (.project) contains the following:
   <projects>
      <project>demo.utility</project>
   </projects>
   Note: the project dependency is required to correctly implement module
dependencies accross projects (in order to get the platform to build the
referenced module before the referencing module tries to archive it).  See
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=103656

I would attach a test case, but I don't think I need to - the bug is fairly
obvious.  PublishServerJob:54 adds an object (refs[i]) to a List (projectList)
but this is done within a loop that is already iterating over the same list
object. Hence the concurrent modification exception:

// add dependant projects
iterator = projectList.iterator();
while (iterator.hasNext()) {
   ...
   if (refs[i] != null && !projectList.contains(refs[i]))
      projectList.add(refs[i]);
   }
}

The exception is as follows:

Created an attachment (id=24750)
Simple patch for this bug

Patch creates a "dependentProjects" list that new projects are added to, rather
than adding to the underlying list.  It's contents are added to the projectList
after iteration.
John - This was already fixed a few days ago. Please verify on a recent build.
Closing old bugs that haven't had any activity in a couple months. If this problem has not been verified or you still have problems, please open a new bug.
